DOC.HEAD: List of Mail Bomb Incidents
With BC-Judge Explosion
DOC.TEXT: The explosion Friday that injured a Maryland judge was the fifth mail bombing within a week directed at individuals and institutions in the legal or civil rights arenas. Here is a list: DEC. 16 _ Judge Robert S. Vance of the 11th Circuit Court of Appeals is killed and and his wife seriously injured when a nail-studded bomb explodes at their home in Birmingham, Ala. DEC. 18 _ Parcel bomb is found at the offices of the 11th Circuit Court of Appeals in Atlanta. The package was defused safely. DEC. 18 _ Alderman and civil rights lawyer Robert E. Robertson is fatally injured when a bomb explodes as he opens a package sent to his office in Savannah, Ga. DEC. 19 _ Another bomb surfaces at the NAACP office in Jacksonville, Fla. and is removed safely. DEC. 22 _ County Circuit Judge John Corderman of Hagerstown, Md. is injured after a bomb explodes in his apartment 20 minutes after a package was delivered.
